TextLibrary.Text: Moarg
There. You're free to go. Now tell me what I want to know.
There. You're free to go. Now tell me what I want to know.
There. You're free to go. Now tell me what I want to know.
There. You're free to go. Now tell me what I want to know.
Free? None of us are truly free... we spend our pitiful lives merely exchanging one form of servitude for another.
Free? None of us are truly free... we spend our pitiful lives merely exchanging one form of servitude for another.
Free? None of us are truly free... we spend our pitiful lives merely exchanging one form of servitude for another.
Free? None of us are truly free... we spend our pitiful lives merely exchanging one form of servitude for another.
I didn't ask for a philosophy lesson. Talk, or I'll take you back to Maethelburg.
I didn't ask for a philosophy lesson. Talk, or I'll take you back to Maethelburg.
I didn't ask for a philosophy lesson. Talk, or I'll take you back to Maethelburg.
I didn't ask for a philosophy lesson. Talk, or I'll take you back to Maethelburg.
First I will give you this sword. It belonged to a Knight from over the mountains to the north - Sir Ector was his name. It is only fitting that it make its way back home.
First I will give you this sword. It belonged to a Knight from over the mountains to the north - Sir Ector was his name. It is only fitting that it make its way back home.
First I will give you this sword. It belonged to a Knight from over the mountains to the north - Sir Ector was his name. It is only fitting that it make its way back home.
First I will give you this sword. It belonged to a Knight from over the mountains to the north - Sir Ector was his name. It is only fitting that it make its way back home.
Now...you want to know the cause of trouble, yes? You seek the root of the evil tree that is spreading its twisted branches over this land and yours...
Now...you want to know the cause of trouble, yes? You seek the root of the evil tree that is spreading its twisted branches over this land and yours...
Now...you want to know the cause of trouble, yes? You seek the root of the evil tree that is spreading its twisted branches over this land and yours...
Now...you want to know the cause of trouble, yes? You seek the root of the evil tree that is spreading its twisted branches over this land and yours...
And I will tell you, because there is nothing you can do about it. Your people will fight, but they will ultimately fail. Their time is over, and the time of my master, Lord Bane, has begun.
And I will tell you, because there is nothing you can do about it. Your people will fight, but they will ultimately fail. Their time is over, and the time of my master, Lord Bane, has begun.
And I will tell you, because there is nothing you can do about it. Your people will fight, but they will ultimately fail. Their time is over, and the time of my master, Lord Bane, has begun.
And I will tell you, because there is nothing you can do about it. Your people will fight, but they will ultimately fail. Their time is over, and the time of my master, Lord Bane, has begun.
Lord Bane? The Dark Horseman of Death? I thought he was only a legend...
Lord Bane? The Dark Horseman of Death? I thought he was only a legend...
Lord Bane? The Dark Horseman of Death? I thought he was only a legend...
Lord Bane? The Dark Horseman of Death? I thought he was only a legend...
Legend indeed. But in the mirror of legend truth is often reflected. My master is quite real. And he is coming for you and your kind.
Legend indeed. But in the mirror of legend truth is often reflected. My master is quite real. And he is coming for you and your kind.
Legend indeed. But in the mirror of legend truth is often reflected. My master is quite real. And he is coming for you and your kind.
Legend indeed. But in the mirror of legend truth is often reflected. My master is quite real. And he is coming for you and your kind.
He will fail.
He will fail.
He will fail.
He will fail.
Ha! His forces are legion. Your Knights have already begun to fall in battle, and my Master has merely sent his scouts ahead of the main force.
Ha! His forces are legion. Your Knights have already begun to fall in battle, and my Master has merely sent his scouts ahead of the main force.
Ha! His forces are legion. Your Knights have already begun to fall in battle, and my Master has merely sent his scouts ahead of the main force.
Ha! His forces are legion. Your Knights have already begun to fall in battle, and my Master has merely sent his scouts ahead of the main force.
You are wrong, sorcerer. Now... go! I said I'd free you and I'll keep my word. But if I see you again, I will kill you myself.
You are wrong, sorcerer. Now... go! I said I'd free you and I'll keep my word. But if I see you again, I will kill you myself.
You are wrong, sorcerer. Now... go! I said I'd free you and I'll keep my word. But if I see you again, I will kill you myself.
You are wrong, sorcerer. Now... go! I said I'd free you and I'll keep my word. But if I see you again, I will kill you myself.
And I will rise from the grave to fight you again... and again... Do you see why you cannot win?
And I will rise from the grave to fight you again... and again... Do you see why you cannot win?
And I will rise from the grave to fight you again... and again... Do you see why you cannot win?
And I will rise from the grave to fight you again... and again... Do you see why you cannot win?

But I do not wish to appear ungrateful. The sword I have given you - it is infused with a dark power. Sir Ector, its previous owner was a fallen Paladin - he turned from your ways to worship my master. When you use it you will see the sword raising skulls on the battlefield.

But I do not wish to appear ungrateful. The sword I have given you - it is infused with a dark power. Sir Ector, its previous owner was a fallen Paladin - he turned from your ways to worship my master. When you use it you will see the sword raising skulls on the battlefield.

But I do not wish to appear ungrateful. The sword I have given you - it is infused with a dark power. Sir Ector, its previous owner was a fallen Paladin - he turned from your ways to worship my master. When you use it you will see the sword raising skulls on the battlefield.

But I do not wish to appear ungrateful. The sword I have given you - it is infused with a dark power. Sir Ector, its previous owner was a fallen Paladin - he turned from your ways to worship my master. When you use it you will see the sword raising skulls on the battlefield.
You too will face a choice, just as Sir Ector did. And if you wish to follow my Master, when the time is right, the sword will guide you.
You too will face a choice, just as Sir Ector did. And if you wish to follow my Master, when the time is right, the sword will guide you.
You too will face a choice, just as Sir Ector did. And if you wish to follow my Master, when the time is right, the sword will guide you.
You too will face a choice, just as Sir Ector did. And if you wish to follow my Master, when the time is right, the sword will guide you.
Now, farewell.
Now, farewell.
Now, farewell.
Now, farewell.
